Home.title: Your AI co-pilot. Dive into collections, discover connections and stories and shape your narrative.
Home.description: With the xCurator, you can immerse yourself in the collections of the Badisches Landesmuseum Karlsruhe and Allard Pierson Amsterdam.
Home.keywords: virtual collection, AI, enrichment, xCurator, museum tool, museum software, online collection

ForWho.title: Who is xCurator for?
ForWho.text:
• For cultural heritage fans and collection enthusiasts - techies and developers - co-thinkers and creatives.
  • For pupils, students, researchers or people with special interests in cultural history.

WhatCanIdo.title: What can I do here?
WhatCanIdo.text:
• Discover: Your view into history: You can immerse yourself in 50,000 years of cultural history, discover connections and develop your own stories. With an experimental neuronal search, you will find exciting and surprising motifs.
  • Create: You can write stories for others and share them. Here you can use high-quality story templates and customise or further develop them according to your wishes.
  • Let machine intelligence support you: various methods of machine learning and generative artificial intelligence will help you and perhaps surprise you with a new perspective?
  • Help the museum: Sometimes the algorithms still have to learn from you. Do you want to confirm correct content and give feedback to others? If you notice anything, we would be delighted to receive your feedback so that we can improve the AI training in the long term!

Data.title: What happens to my data?
Data.text: • To create a story, we ask you to register. You can publish your story for others. For data protection reasons and for content quality assurance, we need your registration here. Your data is safe with us. Please also note the terms of use and privacy policy.

WhatIsAI.title: What does artificial intelligence mean?
WhatIsAI.text:
• Artificial intelligence (AI) is a field of computer science. It involves getting computers to act in certain ways that humans perceive as intelligent. The idea is over 100 years old and today's technology can be used in various applications. You can find artificial intelligence in your smartphone or in your music recommendations. What has been new in recent years is the development of generative technologies that enable images or texts to be created automatically. This is why it is often said that artificial intelligence can also be 'creative'. You can find many exciting learning resources here.
  • Artificial intelligence refers to various technologies, such as artificial neural networks for image recognition or language models for translating or creating texts.
  • Incidentally, we prefer to talk about machine intelligence and have already discussed this a lot. You can read about it here.
  • In xCurator, machine intelligence is used to make the digital collections more accessible, personalised and interest-driven, and to help you make connections and create your own stories.
  • This sometimes works quite well and is helpful, but sometimes we perceive machine-generated results as 'wrong' because many calculations are probabilities or approximate values and a 100% accuracy rate can only be achieved with human help. We must therefore learn to deal with these approximate values, to critically assess machine-generated results or to process them correctly ourselves. This is sometimes not so easy to bear.
  • Perhaps you like collecting errors or helping us to improve the algorithms? You can use the feedback functions to help assess and train machine-generated results and improve the processes.
  • Please note that machine intelligence is not human intelligence - your own judgement is always most important.

WhyAI.title: Why do we use Artificial Intelligence?
WhyAI.text:
• Artificial intelligence should be used ethically and for the common good and support human authorship and responsible behaviour. With xCurator, we worked with the public and experts to find ways to make the digital museum more accessible.
  • Machine learning and deep learning can be used to take a fresh look at what already exists. The ability of artificial neural network processes to reorganise archives or exhibits in collections can make new connections visible.
  • In the Creative User Empowerment project, various methods were investigated and developed to create new access to digital collections using machine intelligence. The focus was always on the question of how the processes can best support users and what role and image we want to attribute to artificial intelligence. We know from the history of ideas that ideas about abstract concepts change over time. Our understanding of artificial intelligence must therefore always be understood historically. To the project documentation and experimental space.

WhereAI.title: Where is artificial intelligence here?
WhereAI.text:
• Wherever you see this symbol, we use machine learning or show results with the help of generative artificial intelligence:
  • Intelligent search: How creatively can you search? The system suggests objects that match your specified interests and searches. On the homepage, museum objects are sorted into so-called clusters, which help you to access the variety of objects in the collection more quickly and coherently. The intelligent search includes a visual search based on similarities and pattern recognition and algorithms pre-sort the variety of content for you. Just give it a try!
  • You can use intelligent filter options to expand or narrow down the search by colour, time, material and location.
  • Machine-generated keywords and intelligent enrichment: New keywords were generated from the image and text information to help create new connections between things. Help the museum by assessing the quality of the keywords and automatic links.
  • Similarity search and recommendations: The images of the objects have been analysed and made accessible via an image search, which means that colours, motifs, objects and themes in images are recognised. Images are sorted into groups by the system so that you are shown content and visual connections. When you create a new story, you will receive recommendations based on your search and title details as to which objects might be suitable.
  • Personalised settings allow you to find more exciting things more quickly and discover your individual approach to the past. Your personal data is safe with us and is not processed by artificial intelligence processes.
  • Generative texts: The tool helps you to create texts and recognise connections between things. You can use xCurator as a co-pilot to develop new, creative and exciting contexts. We have worked a lot on the data basis so that the language model doesn't hallucinate so much, but instead draws on the collection data and really new and exciting content. However, you can give the language model hints as to what it should do for you. But be careful, you have to judge the results of the language model yourself! Simply use the museum texts to help you.
  • For security reasons, we have preset the prompts. If you have any good suggestions on how the prompts can be improved or if you would like a specific prompt for your story, the museum would be happy to hear from you!

WhichAI.title: Which AI processes and models were used exactly?
WhichAI.text:
• xCurator was developed as a reusable and customisable open source software solution, which can be understood in detail here: https://github.com/Badisches-Landesmuseum/xcurator
  • xCurator uses various machine learning methods to support you in indexing, understanding and your own production process. xCurator uses methods from the fields of natural language processing, entity extraction and entity linking, image recognition, intelligent search, multimodal methods and generative language models.
  • Solutions and models from Elastic Search, Open Clip, DeepL, Spacey, Elasticsearch Similarity; Elasticsearch Queries with Spring Data; Alternatives to mapping types; Managing Relations Inside Elasticsearch; Query DSL, Py ElasticSearch Documentation, Py ElasticSearch GitHub, Radbound Entity Linker (REL); flairNLP (Beta), OpenClip a solution from https://github.com/pixolution/embeddings-grid are currently used.
  • We are currently testing the quality of a Named Entity Recognition and Entity Linking System together with the Staatsbibliothek zu Berlin - Preußischer Kulturbesitz (https://staatsbibliothek-berlin.de/) from the QURATOR - Curation Technologies project (https://qurator.ai/) and are improving the hit rate for you:
  • We have discussed, researched and tested a lot: The tool currently also uses the language model solution from OpenAI. Why? Because language models characterise our present day and offer opportunities as well as risks. Because it is important to actively engage with the effects of forms of artificial intelligence such as language models - including in protected spaces and through culture. Here you can practise creating content with the help of language models on a solid factual basis. Your new super skill will be prompting and fact-checking, I promise!
  • In the technical documentation and the Datalab, you can find out more about the technologies and background and also an experimental place that is also exciting for curious people, researchers and developers. Simply join in and become part of the cosmos!

Ethic.title: What ethical guidelines were observed when using and developing machine intelligence?
Ethic.text:
• Ethics guidelines: Our AI initiative is based on the recommendations of the German Ethics Council of 2023.
  • Support through AI: Our aim is to use AI to support visitors and provide better access to art and culture. AI solutions are used in the tool to improve the ability to act in the context of the digital museum visit. We endeavour to promote a realistic understanding of artificial, or rather machine intelligence.
  • Labelling of machine results: We ensure that all content generated by AI is clearly labelled as such to ensure transparency.
  • Avoid misleading AI imagery: We avoid portraying AI as omnipotent in order to promote realistic expectations.
  • No anthropomorphism: We avoid humanising AI in order to promote a clear understanding of how it works.
  • Diversity and internationality in the team: Our international and diverse team involves different user groups in development right from the start.
  • Research and development standards: We always orientate ourselves to the current state of research and development in order to ensure the quality and relevance of AI applications.

HowDeveloped.title: How was the tool developed?
HowDeveloped.text:
• Wild story - better not ask. There was pizza, Club Mate and online meetings.
  • There were various hackathons where wild ideas were developed.
  • A group of interested AI pilots accompanied the project from the start of development and provided information on their wishes and requirements for AI-supported access to the collection. The tool development was only possible thanks to many discussions and digital volunteering - thank you very much!
  • The 3pc team worked on the concept and implementation in 2022 and 2023.
  • The advisory board of the Badisches Landesmuseum has contributed important suggestions for the tool development!
  • The team at the Badisches Landesmuseum and Allard Pierson have had many discussions about the appropriate approach to machine intelligence.
  • In addition, many experts from around the world have contributed knowledge and tips. You can find the list of contributors here.

AIStrategies.title: What AI strategy is behind this?
AIStrategies.text:
• Artificial intelligence is interesting, but not an end in itself: we are developing AI for public welfare goals, increasing data availability, working in an interdisciplinary manner and seeking a broad social dialogue in development.
  • Visitors become users: Not just looking, but finding independent access and deciding for yourself how you want to reuse the collection. We work with a CC-0 licence so that free access to culture is possible and subsequent use is legally secure.
  • Many of the objects are not accessible in on-site exhibitions and are being made digitally accessible here for the first time. We want to offer users worldwide independent access to the museum's collections from any location.
  • Everyone has different interests in terms of content: We support individual access to the collections.
  • We often know little about the background when we look at an object: We improve data availability and data quality with the aim of making it easier to access content-related contexts.
  • So many things - how am I supposed to get an overview or access? We improve the searchability and findability of digital museum objects.
  • The tool is not a single AI, 'the' museum AI or a single neural network, but offers support for individual user requirements through machine learning processes and AI models.
  • The requirements for desired access to the digital collection of the users of the Badisches Landesmuseum and the Allard Pierson Museum always take centre stage.

WithoutAI.title: Is it possible without Artificial Intelligence?
WithoutAI.text: • Yes, of course, you can go to the museum in analogue form or find other digital offers here . You're sure to discover other topics and stories there. The museum looks forward to seeing you!

HowToUse.title: How can I use the tool in schools or educational work?
HowToUse.text: • Recommendations for use in schools can be found here.

HowToHelp.title: How can I contribute to development and improvement?
HowToHelp.text:
• You can create stories with AI support and thus help to make your most important stories accessible to others.
  • You can give feedback if results are unclear or incorrect. We use the feedback to improve the AI processes in the background.
  • You can take a look at the code here and make suggestions on how we can improve the tool.
  • For questions or ideas, simply contact creative@landesmuseum.de

InfoButtons.title: Info buttons
InfoButtons.text:
• These contents were generated using Artificial Intelligence. Please note that human judgment is necessary to ultimately assess accuracy. Content is often not 100% accurate but, for example, only 90% likely. Therefore, it's crucial to critically evaluate the results!
  • This translation was generated by a machine.
  • These keywords were machine-generated through an Entity Recognition algorithm.
  • These images are machine-recognized to provide you with more probable search results.
  • These connections are pre-sorted for you by an image clustering algorithm.
  • This text was automatically generated by a language model. Please carefully review it to ensure it is suitable for your purposes and linguistically and contextually accurate.

Impressum.responsible: Responsible in the sense of the press law
Impressum.disclaimer1: The Badisches Landesmuseum has checked all the information provided to the best of its knowledge and belief. However, due to the use of AI-generated content, no guarantee can be given for accuracy in all cases. AI-generated content is identified as such and should be checked thoroughly in case of doubt. No guarantee can be given for the topicality, correctness, completeness or quality and availability of the application at all times. Unless otherwise stated, all texts, images, illustrations, documents and files are subject to copyright. They may not be reproduced or published without the express permission of the Badisches Landesmuseum.
Impressum.copyrightsText: In the case of AI-generated content on our portal, it is generally permitted to copy, print and distribute the texts and documents attached to them. AI-generated content without human contribution is currently in the public domain (12/2023). If they are protected by copyright, they can be used and distributed under the free license specified in each case, subject to the conditions.
Impressum.contracted: The Federal Government Commissioner for Culture and the Media
Impressum.pictureCreditsText: The license for the picture is in the data record.

Impressum.moreInfosText-2: Declaration on the accessibility of the Badisches Landesmuseum.

TermsOfUse.section-1: Welcome to xCurator. This document sets out the terms and conditions for the use of the application https://xcurator.landesmuseum.de offered by the Badisches Landesmuseum Karlsruhe ('we', 'our') as part of the 'xCurator' application and website (the 'Website'). By creating an account with us, users ('users', 'users', 'users', 'users', 'you', 'your') agree to comply with this agreement. Please read this document carefully and if you have any questions, please contact digital@landesmuseum.de.
TermsOfUse.possibilities-1: The xCurator is a curating tool that allows users to discover the collections of the Badisches Landesmuseum and Allard Pierson Amsterdam in a completely new way. Using technologies from the field of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML), the tool helps users to perceive the diversity of the objects, discover new connections, get to know contexts and explore topics in greater depth according to their own interests. With xCurator, users can take on the role of curator themselves and create their own story from the collection.
TermsOfUse.possibilities-2: The xCurator enables users to find and compile content with the help of artificial intelligence (AI) methods and generate new content by creating their own connections from the collections. The new content created in this way can be saved in the xCurator profile and optionally shared with the general public and released for use.
TermsOfUse.registration-1: You do not need an account to use xCurator passively. If you want to create your own posts or respond to other posts, you must create a user account with us.
TermsOfUse.registration-2: You can create an account by (a) registering with your email address and password; (b) using your existing Google account, Facebook account or (c) using an existing user account at the Badisches Landesmuseum.
TermsOfUse.registration-3: You must be at least 18 years old to register, unless a lower age is permitted by law in your country or territory. If you are not old enough to be eligible to agree to our Terms in your country or territory, your parent or legal guardian must agree to our Terms on your behalf in order for you to use our services. Please ask your parent or guardian to read these Terms with you.
TermsOfUse.aiGenerated-1: Technologies such as artificial intelligence and machine learning enable us to apply complex processes to our service. Automated technologies also help us to ensure the functionality and integrity of our service. You can find out more about this in the privacy policy.
TermsOfUse.aiGenerated-2: In the following accesses, artificial intelligence processes are used that influence the presentation and perception of the collections:
TermsOfUse.aiGenerated-list:
• Neural search - makes it possible to search for semantically and visually similar content.
  • Embeddings - enable the recognition of visual features in images.
  • Automatic translations were applied to the object descriptions. All texts were translated with the help of the AI service DeepL.
  • Clustered collection content - makes it possible to display related collection content even in a large amount of data.
  • Automatically generated tags - enable extended networking of content and new contexts.
  • Automatic links - allow terms in texts to be recognized and automatically linked to external content. These links were created automatically and are not always correct. The error rate is currently 30%, we are trying to improve this.
  • Generated texts - texts are created automatically with the help of a language model. In the story area, you are supported by a language model when creating your story. There are free text fields here that you can either use yourself or have a suggestion made. As the user, you are responsible for checking and approving the content generated with the help of the language model.
TermsOfUse.publicContent-1: You have the option to publish your posts on xCurator. Please always remember that your posts are publicly accessible as soon as you set them to 'Public'.
TermsOfUse.publicContent-2: You are the author of your story. If you decide to publish, the stories and content will be available to the general public for free use and distribution. For this purpose, the license is set to Creative Commons CC0 by default. This means that the story can be used freely and without conditions by the general public as open content. You can also choose a different Creative Commons license for a story yourself.
TermsOfUse.responsibility: Care and responsibility when sharing stories, prohibited content
TermsOfUse.responsibility-1: You are responsible for sharing your stories; the Badisches Landesmuseum does not check the content before publication. Please therefore check the results thoroughly and critically. Not all AI-generated content (keywords, external links, texts, quality of search results, results of image recognition) can be quality-assured by specialist staff at the museum. As a user, you are responsible for curating your own content. xCurator is your co-pilot, but you are the pilot. By creating, curating and sharing stories, you agree to the following:
TermsOfUse.responsibility-2: You respect the privacy rights of others and represent and warrant to the Badisches Landesmuseum that you have obtained all necessary consents in relation to any personal information (of another person) that you have provided to the Badisches Landesmuseum and that - subject to our privacy policy - the Badisches Landesmuseum may use this personal information for the operation of the website.
TermsOfUse.responsibility-3: You may not collect personally identifiable information (e.g. images, video, audio recordings, name, etc.) of others from the website or publish, distribute or otherwise use personally identifiable information of others on the website unless you have express permission to process this information/content. Please note the respective licensing of the contributions provided.
TermsOfUse.responsibility-4: You may not use the Website to upload, transmit or link to Prohibited Content. Prohibited content generally includes content or other material that we believe is prohibited or inappropriate:
TermsOfUse.responsibility-5: Content that is offensive, deceptive, pornographic, obscene, defamatory or objectionable, encourages conduct that would violate or infringe any law, is harassing, hateful, racially or ethnically offensive or otherwise inappropriate;
TermsOfUse.responsibility-6: Content that includes material that is copyrighted, protected by trade secret, or otherwise subject to third party proprietary or trademark rights, including rights of privacy, unless there is express written permission from the owner to use the material and to grant all license rights granted herein;
TermsOfUse.responsibility-7: Content that infringes or otherwise violates the rights of others;
TermsOfUse.responsibility-8: content published on behalf of another person/organization;
TermsOfUse.responsibility-9: content that advocates or promotes illegal activities;
TermsOfUse.responsibility-10: Content that depicts minors in a pornographic, sexually suggestive and/or violent manner;
TermsOfUse.responsibility-11: Content that harms anyone, especially minors or
TermsOfUse.responsibility-12: Content that provides a link or reference to any of the above content
TermsOfUse.responsibility-13: You agree to indemnify and hold the Badisches Landesmuseum harmless from any damages, liabilities, costs, expenses, losses, claims or demands (collectively, 'Losses'), including reasonable attorneys' fees, arising out of or in connection with your use of the Website, including your violation of this Agreement and including any claim that any Content you provide to us or Members infringes the intellectual property or other rights of any third party.
TermsOfUse.deleteStories-1: You can delete your story in your account at any time. Please note, however, that published stories that are released for use by the general public may be reused by third parties.
TermsOfUse.deleteStories-2: Administrators have the right to delete your story if it violates the terms of use. It is at the sole discretion of the Badisches Landesmuseum to determine whether the content is prohibited content. If administrators delete your story, this is a consequence of the violation of the terms of use. You will not receive a message in this case. In exceptional cases, administrators can contact you by email and ask questions about your content before it is deleted. If you have any questions about deleted stories, please contact: digital@landesmuseum.de
TermsOfUse.availability-1: The Badisches Landesmuseum does not warrant that a) the website will be uninterrupted, timely or error-free, b) the results that may be obtained from the use of the website will be accurate or reliable, c) the quality, accuracy, timeliness, truth, completeness or reliability of any content, products, services, information or other materials obtained through the website will meet your expectations, or d) any errors in the website or software will be corrected.
TermsOfUse.dataPrivacy-1: Information about what personal data of yours is processed, for what purposes, for how long, by whom and how it is processed, as well as your rights, can be found in our privacy policy. You can find the privacy policy of the Badisches Landesmuseum at
TermsOfUse.deleteProfil: Delete the profile, cancel, discontinue the service
TermsOfUse.deleteProfil-1: You can delete your profile in the xCurator profile area. Your data will then be permanently deleted. This includes your name, password and personalized content. If you delete your profile in xCurator, your stories will also be deleted.  Please note, however, that published stories that are released for use by the general public may be reused by third parties.
TermsOfUse.deleteProfil-2: Your registration in the user account of the Badisches Landesmuseum will be retained so that you can continue to use other offers of the Landesmuseum. For the deletion and termination of your user account, the provisions of the corresponding privacy policy apply.
TermsOfUse.deleteProfil-3: If you would also like to delete your user account, send an email to digital@landesmuseum.de
TermsOfUse.deleteProfil-4: This agreement remains in force until it is terminated either by the Badisches Landesmuseum (e.g. for good cause) or by you.
TermsOfUse.deleteProfil-5: The Badisches Landesmuseum does not guarantee a specific duration of xCurator, but will announce the discontinuation of the service with reasonable notice so that you can save your content.

Tutorials.create-page-1: Discover the stories of others here and create your own. Just give it a try!
Tutorials.create-page-2-1: Lacking ideas? Use AI for inspiration, but be critical of AI-generated content.
Tutorials.create-page-2-2: You can find more information on AI technologies in the
Tutorials.create-page-3: You can decide whether to publish your story and share it with others.
Tutorials.explore-page-1-1: Your AI-powered co-pilot will help you on your discovery tour through the collection. Work together with xCurator and find out what you can achieve together.
Tutorials.explore-page-1-2: Here you get a few short explanations on how to work with our tool.
Tutorials.explore-page-2-3: It is possible that errors have crept in. In this case, we look forward to your feedback. Because it helps us to continue training the AI solutions!
Tutorials.explore-page-3: Take your search to a new level: use filters to discover new things or make unknown connections using keywords. Customize your museum tour according to your interests.
